title: Publications
text:
GRDI-AMR.com maintains a publicly-available library of publications related to the GRDI-AMR1|2 projects. For more information, see the publication library documentation.
The library is compiled on a best-effort basis and may be incomplete.

title: Software and Tools
text: Software and tools developed as part of the GRDI-AMR1|2 projects.

title: Software and Tools
text:
Acheron
Acheron is a command line based workflow manager that allows for large scale, fast, and memory efficient machine-learning analyses of whole-genome sequence data.

title: Software and Tools
text:
BaitCapture
BaitCapture is a bioinformatics workflow designed for processing sequencing data obtained from targeted resistome bait-capture sequencing, built using Nextflow.

title: Software and Tools
text:
ConFindr
ConFindr is designed to find bacterial intra-species contamination in raw Illumina data.

title: Software and Tools
text:
DataHarmonizer
DataHarmonizer is a standardized browser-based spreadsheet editor and validator, which works off of LinkML data specifications.

title: Software and Tools
text:
GRDI-AMR Data Specification
The GRDI-AMR Data Specification for harmonizing One Health AMR pathogen genomics contextual data.

title: Software and Tools
text:
MOB-suite
MOB-suite is a group of software tools for clustering, reconstruction and typing of plasmids from draft assemblies.

title: Software and Tools
text:
staramr
staramr (*AMR) scans bacterial genome contigs against the ResFinder, PointFinder, and PlasmidFinder databases and compiles a summary report of detected antimicrobial resistance genes.

title: About
text:
From the official GRDI website:

The intramural Genomics Research and Development Initiative (GRDI) funds genomics research in eight federal science departments and agencies. It supports innovation and evidence-based regulatory, policy, and resource management decisions. It focuses on areas where government is best able to address issues important to Canadians. Government priorities and the needs of end users drive the GRDI.

title: About
text:
From the official GRDI website:

The intramural Genomics Research and Development Initiative (GRDI) funds genomics research in eight federal science departments and agencies. It supports innovation and evidence-based regulatory, policy, and resource management decisions. It focuses on areas where government is best able to address issues important to Canadians. Government priorities and the needs of end users drive the GRDI.

title: About
text:
AMR
Antimicrobial resistance (AMR) refers to the ability of microorganisms, such as bacteria, fungi, or viruses, to withstand (or partially withstand) the effects of an antimicrobial to which they were formerly susceptible.

title: About
text:
The GRDI-AMR(1) project
The GRDI-AMR(1) project provided $11.1 million over six years (2016 - 2022) to support the development of genomic resources used to understand and combat AMR in the agri-food system.

title: About
text:
The GRDI-AMR(2) project
The GRDI-AMR(2) project is providing $9.8 million over five years (2022 - 2027) to build upon the successes of the GRDI-AMR1 project and further address AMR using a One Health approach.

title: About
text:
GRDI-AMR.com
The GRDI-AMR.com website (this website) is an unofficial resource used to share public information about the GRDI-AMR1 and GRDI-AMR2 projects. For more details, see here.
Built using Quarto. Served using GitHub Pages. Developed by Brennan Chapman.
For questions, comments, or concerns, please contact: admin@grdi-amr.com.

title: Announcing GRAPL
text:
Today we’re announcing the availability of the GRDI-AMR Publication Library or GRAPL (pronounced “grapple”).
The GRDI-AMR Publication Library or GRAPL is a Zotero Group Library created and maintained by Brennan Chapman (@chapb) to catalogue publications associated with the GRDI-AMR1 and GRDI-AMR2 projects.
Learn more here.
